page.title: 09Shops in our area
page.content: The butcher's shop was originally a green grocers.It opened in May 1985. The shop employs 4 people.They were given a hygiene award for efficiency, health and hygiene. Siop Ganol is owned by Mr.& Mrs.Ellis. They have been living there since 1978.It was built in 1934.Siop Ganol was once a cafe,owned by the Reid family.The shop was built by the Walkers who lived in Bod-Hyfryd.Now the shop sells most home needs and also daily and weekly papers. The original post office began in July 1896,but the present building was built in 1954.The post office has wool,sweets,tobacco and has a Giro bank. Most people in the village think there are enough shops,and think we do well for a small village.
